result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa G Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa G Richardson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melissa G Richardson was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Melissa G Richardson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Melissa G Richardson was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to either the Crawford County jail or the Grant County jail, no later than 6:00 PM on Friday September 16th. Entitled to good time and approved to serve jail time in another county. Huber/EM approved. No jail credit.
Consecutive to: to any other sentences being served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa G Richardson

records.addlTxt:
3:06 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Melissa G Richardson in court.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Melissa G Richardson.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Stroud is heard, ready to proceed with plea and sentencing. Attorney Stroud approaches bench with plea questionnaire. 
State is heard on sentencing. Joint recommendation...15 day jail sentence, fine of $100.00 plus cost on the OAR. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a plea of Guilty. Court accepts the defendants plea of Guilty and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

Attorney Stroud requests Huber/EM.  Requests a concurrent sentence to any other sentence in any other county. 
Defendant is heard and requests jail and no probation. 
State is heard on sentence. 

Court orders- jail not be concurrent. 
Ct 1 - 343.44(1)(b) - Operating While Revoked ($100.00 fine plus cost) Guilty Total $579.00 
Ct 2 - 947.01(1) - Disorderly Conduct ($100.00 fine plus cost) Guilty Total $579.00
Ct 3 - 946.41(1) - Resisting or Obstructing an Officer (15 day jail, sentence stayed until Friday September 16th, to report to either the Crawford Co jail or Grant Co jail, no later than 6:00 PM, entitled to good time, approved to serve in another county, approved Huber/EM, no jail credit, Court costs $443.00) Guilty

Total $1,601.00 PP approved $50.00 pr mo commencing Oct 1st, 2022 and each month thereafter. $15.00 PPF. 

Ct 4 - 946.49(1)(a) - Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor (DISMISSED) State moves to dismiss; Court orders count 4 dismissed. 

22FO09 (DISMISSED) State moves to dismiss; Court orders case dismissed. 
22TR76 (DISMISSED) State moves to dismiss; Court orders case dismissed. 
22TR77 (DISMISSED) State moves to dismiss; Court orders case dismissed.

9:19 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Melissa G Richardson appeared by phone.  Attorney Tripp Stroud appeared by video for Melissa G Richardson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Stroud is heard on the status of the case. Requests a plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:00 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Melissa G Richardson appeared by phone.  Attorney Donald Ritchey Stroud III appeared by video for Melissa G Richardson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Stroud is heard on status - have received offer from state, need time to discuss with def - requests another status date
Jury status hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:34 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Melissa G Richardson appeared by video.  Attorney Donald Ritchey Stroud III appeared by phone for Melissa G Richardson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant enters a not guilty plea to each of the four counts in 22CM07.
Defendant enters a not guilty plea into each forfeiture case - 22FO09, 22TR76, 22TR77 and each case will follow along with 22CM07.
Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion for Preservation of Evidence & Petition for Leave to File Additional Motions
Adjourned initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.

1:39 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Melissa G Richardson appeared in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

DA requests a signature bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 


Court orders $500.00 signature bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
